intro: Grewia caudata, commonly known as the silky bush or silky thornapple, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows up to 3 meters in height. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers that are clustered in spherical inflorescences. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a silvery or woolly underside. The fruit is a small, three-lobed capsule that turns red when mature.
